reviews.sentence: Home Away from Home. We needed a place to stay for a few nights during our home renovation and wanted more than just a hotel room. This place was perfect for our family of 4. It was like staying in a little apartment complete with a full kitchen. Our suite had a loft with a full bath as well as a bedroom with another complete bath on the main level. Lots of space for all and the kids loved having their own TVs to watch. We liked the layout of the suite. The loft upstairs gave us lots of room so no one was tripping over anyone elses belongings. Lots of restaurants nearby at the Manhattan Village Mall or The Point. Also very close to the beach with more places to eat and shop. The bedding for the hide a bed sofa was well worn and in desperate need of replacing. Yuck.

Average. This is an older property and there have some construction going on it looks like remodeling maybe. The room was fine over crowded with furniture for the size of the room. The bathroom was small and the shower curtain rod was broken and hung down low. The kitchen was equipped with everything you need if you were picking something up at the store. The bed was fine the workout room was a bit small but well maintained. The breakfast was good.

Als Well but Fees. I have reviewed this Residence Inn in the past in detail. I have always been a big fan and have said so to those I care for at Mariot headquarters in Bethesda. I typically spend 1 2 weeks here yearly this year 11 days. I believe we stayed at the very farthest corner of the complex in 724. It overlooks a Toyota dealership and the parking lot which might not seem to be appealing but we were always out and about. The staff is friendly but many who knew us have left. The exercise room is great to burn off some steam. The breakfasts have a lot of the same choices as other Residence Inns but perhaps prepared better and with prompt restocking. Three nights a week there are socials. One is the BQ. There are several beer and wine choices. This year all the burgers were pre cooked in a bin and I have to say it was more fun the old way getting them hot off the grill. It was not a weather issue. The room we stayed in was nice and maybe newer than those we stayed in previously located closer to the pool. This Residence Inn is probably one of the most expensive in the Los Angeles and Orange County areas. They have updated their lobby and eating areas in the past as well as maintained the grounds. I have always felt the pricing given the location and such was in the range of reasonable. They recently added a parking fee of five dollars per night. If your family has a second car that is added on too. They added this fee after I had reserved my room and kindly waived it upon asking noting it had just started. I appreciate the gesture. My advice is just charge what you need to for the room and keep it simple. Sometimes extra fees just spread resentment. Certainly large resorts have lots of additional fees. This is not a resort. I hope they reconsider this fee which I know is modest. Otherwise as always I think families will enjoy their stay here.

Good base in LA. This hotel was recommended by a work colegue as a good base in LA. We stayed in a renovated block which was nice but there is background noise in the area. Staff were friendly and helpful which made our stay pleasant. The kitchen was the best feature and helped keep costs down. Plus the complimentary breakfast was good although it needed more space for the number of people. I would stay here again.
Hotel is very spread out. Rooms need updating and cosmetic fixes.

Decent but needs a remodel. We only stayed the one night and it was fine. The room itself needs to be remodeled badly but even with that it was still clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff is super friendly and helpful. I asked for a room with two beds instead of one and they made it happen for me. The breakfast is decent. They do not have an espresso machine but the kitchen staff steamed up some milk for me for a latte. The breakfast is ONLY until 9 am and they were closing doors and cleaning up by 857 so be sure to give yourself time to get down there. There is no restaurant or bar but they do have a happy hour. We did not participate as it was not until 730 for whatever reason and we walked down the street and had a fantastic dinner at Manhattan House. All in all it was fine but I do not think I had stay here again until they do a remodel.
Good location needs updating. Good location underwhelmed with room conditions. Need updating of rooms good breakfast.

Very unsatisfied. I checked in today and have been trying to find another hotel for the past 4 hours so I can get out of here. The room is a penthouse and the corner faces the pool. You can hear all the noises every scream from the pool and playground. The room smells and there are stains on the carpet and furniture. Everything is very very worn. Most of the electric sockets are stripped so I I can not charge my phone in the main room the plug just falls out. The caulking in the bathroom is separating from the bathtub and fixtures and the baseboards are pulling away from the wall in the bathroom. The windows are fogged and the internet keeps going on off because of the construction. They are apparently renovating. It is really gross and not a typical Mariot property especially for 325 per night. Maybe if you get a renovated room it would be better but this is one of the worst hotel experiences that I have ever had. One positive the front desk was very nice although they could not move me to a better room.
Good location. Good location close to LA airport Manhattan beach shopping etc. Hotel presently being renovated and will be quite nice when completed.

Newly renovated big fail. Have been coming to this Mariot property for over a year. Until this last trip they were an outstanding property. With the new renovation it is a big fail. While I love energy efficient units this one fails especially in the bathroom when the sensors turn off the lights every five minutes and the sensors do not work. There is no window in the bathroom so you are in total darkness. Waving your hand in front of the sensor does nothing so you have to reach over to turn the lights back on. Finally on day 5 of a 9 night stay engineering came by to install a manual light switch. There is hardly any parking available if you get back to the property after 6 pm. Did not know that they charge for overnight parking as I have not been charged on previous stays in the past year. This is the first time second according the Argel the manager that I have been charged for parking on my previous 8 stays or so. I had been waived the fee because of Platinum Elite status in the Mariot Rewards program. I suppose now with the merger with SPG and Ritz it does not mean anything. And why charge for parking when there is not any. There is parking at the Target but only had to do that one night. Expect to park far from your unit if you return late. Also the manager Argel states to contact him but he does not get back to you. Of course he apologizes when brought to his attention but why offer if you are not seriousThe positive notes of this property is it is location. But with the current management I will find another Mariot SPG Ritz property in the future. There is a Westdrift not too far and their management is much more responsive. Have stayed there twice to allow for the completion of the renovation at Residence Inn. it is just so unfortunate since I like having a kitchenette and full fridge always staying a week or more. I can no longer recommend this property.
Lovely place to stay very beach inspired and newly built renovated a few maintenance items needing to be attended too but a really nice place to stay.

Team One Volleyball Group Great Place to Stay. We recently stayed at this property with our Beach Volleyball Club Team One Volleyball Chicago. We were traveling with 14 of our players and 2 coaches. Donna was awesome to deal with for our group booking. She communicated quickly and clearly. This property was recently remodeled and was in beautiful condition. Each of the rooms were nicely done and we certainly appreciated having our own full kitchen and living room. This unique property is in a perfect location near most of the stores and right down the street from the downtown area. Property is kind of secluded from the street noise so that was really nice at night. They also provided us with a nice buffet style full breakfast this worked out really well for our hungry athletes. The part that I was most impressed with was the staff. Everyone was overly friendly and really wanted to make our stay enjoyable. You guys are doing a fantastic job guys. Donna thank you again for making our stay so warm and comforting.

I ’ve been to this area several times and have to say this hotel is one of the best options in terms of proximity to LAX and the beach. The neighborhood is very walkable with plenty of restaurants shops grocery stores within walking distance. The beach is a little under a mile and a fairly easy walk downhill. You may want to plan on catching an Uber coming back since it is mostly uphill. If you use the “ ride share ” option it should n’t cost more than 34. The staff is very attentive and the grounds are kept up nice. As Mariot gold member they usually upgrade me to a two bedroom two bathroom here which it honestly feels more like an apartment than a hotel room. Rooms are large updated and clean the included breakfast is good fitness room is more than adequate. The pool area looks nice although I ’ve never used it. There is a happy hour Mon Wed night and its great for grabbing a drink or two and appetizers. I ’d definitely recommend staying here over the hotels closer to LAX mainly because the location is much better and it ’s quiet. An Uber Lyft will run 10 14 to from LAX and the drive takes anywhere from 10 25min depending on traffic it ’s about 4 miles. On the weekends it should n’t be more than 15 minutes. For what it ’s worth I prefer Manhattan Beach over Venice and Santa Monica. I find it more laid back and relaxing.

Good service friendly and helpful staff great location near several soccer fields where our grandkids played soccer. The units have been refurbished since our last visit. The grounds were much improved. The unit was well thought out for a single person or a couple. The couch was not very comfortable. The breakfast was one of the best I have seen.
Exceptional. Its so beautiful inside the new renovation is perfect. everything was so close. Pier was 10 min away. everything was perfect.

Great experience from check in to checkout. Staff is so friendly and on top of it. The rooms have recently been renovated and are great. Location is great easy drive or bike to beach. Would definitely stay again without a doubt.

Great stay. Second family trip to California and my family loves this hotel. Great customer service clean and updated rooms parking is great even when busy. Very good breakfast and my favorite awesome workout room.
Really nicely updated and conveniently located to the Manhattan beach.
The rooms have been refurbished and are beautiful. The location to Manhattan Beach is perfect.
Love our stay here while our home was having repairs done. Staff was friendly and the rooms we very comfortable and nicely maintained.
